Very good game. Fun right the way through. Puzzles aren't too difficult or easy. Story is amusing. Got it on sale. It's more than worth the price.
it deleted my savefile and i can't be bothered to play everything again... but its a good game. They need to fix some bugs.

Portal 1 set the stage for a new type of game. It was lovely, sweet, and short. Portal 2 brings vast environments and deep lore. What an absolute masterpiece. The game is long enough to satisfy your Valve cravings yet short enough that it does not get repetitive. 10/10, would play several times over (once I forget the puzzles).

Great game. Incredible multiplayer, especially if you're playing with a personal friend, and the singleplayer's better than the first game. They both ultimately feel like a tech demo and the puzzles can be somewhat underwhelming for fans of the genre, but they're still great regardless

The puzzle solving in a first person view is wonderful and helps you learn how to solve unusual problems. And like any good game with a level editor and community content, this only makes the game at least three times better.

It is 100x times better than its prequel from every aspect: 
>Better Graphics
>Funny as hell (intersting dialogues, unexpected jokes)
>More gameplay
>New gameplay features

In my opinion you have to play its prequel to enjoy this game and understand the plot.
10/10
-Skang

Compelling puzzle game, which is a sequel to the first Portal game.
Compared to that, this game is longer, and concentrates more on the story while at the same time just as fun with the puzzles  as the first game. Now that I mentioned it, the story of this game is great. It's one of the best I've seen, and it's really a game of its own kind, since not many puzzle games have a story this good. Nor are there many puzzle games that would be as fun as this for a long period of time like this game was. Even though it was long, the level design was great and at some points really challenging as well. 
In terms of graphics, this game is beautiful. That is also one aspect where it has improved compared to the first game.
Gameplay is similar to the first Portal, but it has been improved a bit too.
There is also a co-op mode in Portal 2, so if you want to play with a friend after completing the game yourself, that is possible as well.

8/10

Soundtrack 10/10: Idk man it's just a good soundtrack
Gameplay 10/10: Includes everything from the original game (except maybe hyperexcited pellets) and several new features as well. Co-op is great, although I haven't played it very much. Awesome level editor.
Story 9/10: Great story filled with plot twists and the secrets of Aperture, although I do miss Wheatley

Overall rating: 10/10
great, love playing the community's levels some smart people are there really

A perfect continuation of the Portal franchise! I also LOOOOOVE that it's MULTIPLAYER - yes you heard it - M-U-L-T-I-P-L-A-Y-E-R! Oh BTW - there are SOOOOOOO many more Half-Life/Black Mesa references here (and also Rattmann-references)!!!!!!!!!!
